intro: Sabia yunnanensis subsp. yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan sabia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
